Since the avatar's position has not changed from the last state, I will analyze the current state for possible actions. 

The avatar (a) is located at (1, 1), and the only nearby sprite is a scared sprite (@) located at (1, 14). The surrounding walls and the open spaces are taken into account. To eliminate the scared sprite, I will move towards the right.

I will proceed with the action to the right:

``` Action: 2 ``` 

This action aligns with the strategy of positioning towards the scared sprite so that I can interact with it on subsequent turns.

Since the avatar's position has still not changed after the action to the right, I need to analyze the current game state again. 

The avatar (a) is located at (1, 1). The nearby elements include a scared sprite (@) located at (1, 15) and there are walls above and below the avatar which restrict its movement. Given the action history indicates I tried moving right but did not move, I should instead try moving down this time since it may give me better positioning relative to the scared sprites.

I will proceed with the action to move down:

``` Action: 3 ```

This action aligns with the strategy of repositioning to finally catch the scared sprites. I am hopeful this will allow me to move closer to the scared sprites in the next turn.
